intro: Tradescantia virginica f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The varietal name 'albiflora' refers to its distinctive white flowers, which set it apart from other varieties of spiderwort.
